productSpecification:
The following features are delivered through the hardware.

     

  • WAN:

    • One of the following:
      • Embedded 1200M-B LTE Advanced Pro modem (with DC-HSPA+ failover))
      • Embedded 1200M LTE Advanced Pro modem (with DC-HSPA+ failover)
      • Embedded 600M LTE Advanced modem (with DC-HSPA+ failover)
    • MC400 slot for optional 2nd modular modem
    • 10 10/100/1000 ethernet ports (cable/DSL/T1/satellite/Metro Ethernet; WAN/LAN switchable)
    • WiFi (as WAN; Metro WiFi) 2×2 MIMO 2.4 GHz and 4×4 MIMO 5 GHz (802.11 a/b/g/n/ac)

  • LAN:

    • Dual-band, dual-concurrent WiFi (802.11 a/b/g/n/ac wave 2)
    • 10 10/100/1000 ethernet ports (WAN/LAN switchable)
    • Serial console

  • Temperature:

    • 0 °C to 50 °C (32 °F to 122 °F) operating
    • -20 °C to 70 °C (-4 °F to 158 °F) storage

  • Humidity (non-condensing):

    • 5% to 95% operating
    • 5% to 95% storage

  • Memory:

    • 512 MB DRAM; 8 GB eMMC

  • Size:

    • 7.3 × 8.3 × 1.7 in (185 × 210 × 44 mm)
    • 1U height for rack mount

  • Weight:

    • 3 lb 5 oz (1.5 kg)

  • Certifications:

    • WiFi Alliance – 802.11a/b/g/n/ac wave 2 certified
      • Safety: UL/CUL, CB Scheme, EN60950-1
      • Materials: WEEE, RoHS, RoHS-2, California Prop 65
      • Telecom: PTCRB/CTIA, GCF-CC
      • FIPS 140-2 Inside versions available

  • WIFI Power (FCC):

    • 2402–2483.5 MHz (2.4 GHz band): 28.3 dBm conducted
    • 5150–5250 MHz (5 GHz band 1): 29.1 dBm conducted
    • 5725–5850 MHz (5 GHz band 3): 30.0 dBm conducted

  • WIFI Power (Europe/Rest of World):

    • 2.4 GHz band: 19.88 dBm EIRP
    • 5150-5250 MHz: 22.96 dBm EIRP

  • GPS:

    • Modem-based GPS

packagecontents.text: (1) AER2200 with embedded LTE Advanced (600M) modem

getConnect:
Connect a Wired WAN

  1. Connect the provided Ethernet cable to the WAN port of the router.
    • NOTE: The port labeled 'WAN' is the default. However, all ports are LAN/WAN switchable.
insertSim:
Insert Activated SIM Cards

  1. Remove the modem door
    • Check bottom of the device for the modem door screw.


  1. Insert an active 2FF-sized SIM card into the slot with the contacts up and notch in. It will click into place. Depress the SIM card to remove it.
  1. Repeat for SIM 2 if needed.



Insert an External MC400 Modem (optional)

  1. Insert 1 or 2 active 2FF-sized SIM cards in to the MC400 modem, contacts down, notch in.


  1. Insert the MC400 modem into the router, USB port in, Cradlepoint logo up.


  1. Replace the MC400 modem door cover and secure with door cover screw.


    • NOTE: Remove plastic SMA covers on the modem door to expose port openings.

    • NOTE: The modem door must be on the device or the embedded modem will not power on.
attachCellularAntenna:
Attach the 4G LTE Antennas

  1. Attach the included cellular modem antennas to the ports marked MAIN and AUX.
    • NOTE: Cellular antennas include RP-SMA connectors (pin in the center on the antenna) while Wi-Fi antennas include SMA connectors (pin in the center on the device connection point). Ensure you connect the correct antennas to their applicable connection locations.


  1. Hold the antenna straight and twist the base onto the device. Tighten with fingers only (maximum torque not to exceed 4 in-lbs). Do not over-tighten.
  1. Angle the antennas based on the following diagram.



Attach MC400 4G LTE Antennas

  1. Attach the included cellular modem antennas to the ports marked MAIN and AUX.


  1. Hold the antenna straight and twist the base onto the device. Tighten with fingers only (maximum torque not to exceed 4 in-lbs). Do not over-tighten.
  1. Angle the antennas based on the following diagrams.
attachWifiAntenna:
Attach the Wi-Fi Antennas

  1. Attach the included Wi-Fi antennas to the ports marked 2.4/5GHz and 5GHz.


  1. Hold the antenna straight and twist the base onto the device. Tighten with fingers only (maximum torque not to exceed 4 in-lbs). Do not over-tighten.
  1. Align the antenna at a 90-degree angle to the mounting surface.
poweron:
Connect the Power Source

  1. Connect the power supply to the router and then plug the other end into an electrical outlet.
  1. Switch the device to ON (O = OFF, – = ON). The LED lights will begin lighting up.
